question_results.question: Legislation and regulations in Australia relating to the enrolment of international students are:
correct_answers: The ESOS Act 2000 and The National Code of Practice 2018
extracted_answers: The ESOS Act 2000 and The National Code of Practice 2018
question_results.full_response:
International education in Australia is regulated through Acts of Parliament and associated regulations at both the Federal and State levels. Some of the key aspects of these regulations include the ESOS Act, the National Code, CRICOS registration, Student Visa Regulations, and Privacy legislation.

question_results.question: Which of the following circumstances is NOT reported online through PRISMS by an educational institution:
correct_answers: Students finishing their ELICOS course one week later due to approved vacation.

question_results.question: A student you recruited to study in Australia has been very sick and been taken to hospital. They have not provided the institution with a current address. This may mean:
correct_answers: The student will not receive any letters about their possible non-compliance with visa conditions
extracted_answers: The student will not receive any letters about their possible non-compliance with visa conditions
question_results.full_response:
If the student has not provided the institution with a current postal address, a formal letter from PRISMS regarding non-compliance may not reach the student, but the student visa may still be cancelled because it is the student’s responsibility to ensure the provider has their current postal address.

question_results.question: A student you recruited to study in Australia has contacted you. Their school has been forced to close down and they will no longer be able to attend classes. Which of the following is likely to happen to the student because their school is closing:
correct_answers: The student should be able to transfer to another school in Australia because their status as an international student is protected by the ESOS Act 2000 and the Tuition Protection Service (TPS).
extracted_answers: The student will have to go back to their home country because they will no longer be enrolled at a school in Australia. The school will cancel their visa and help them move back to home. The student will receive a refund from the School.
question_results.full_response:
If a student's school closes, the provider will inform DHA and the student visa will be cancelled if the student does not enroll in another course.

question_results.question: DHA considers evidentiary requirements for students from different countries on the basis of:
correct_answers: Statistical evidence of how students from that country comply with their visa conditions based on previous students’ behaviour in the last 12 months.
extracted_answers: Statistical evidence of how students from that country comply with their visa conditions based on previous students’ behaviour in the last 12 months.
question_results.full_response:
The evidentiary requirements for each student application are determined by DHA on the basis of a combination of the rating of the student’s country of citizenship and the rating of the provider with which they will undertake their principal course of study.

question_results.question: A student you recruited to study in Australia is studying a Bachelor of Engineering at university on a Student Visa. The student is finding their study program very difficult and would like to study part- time rather than full-time. The student can:
correct_answers: Not change to part-time study. Under The National Code students on student visa are not allowed to study part-time.
extracted_answers: Not change to part-time study. Under The National Code students on student visa are not allowed to study part-time.
question_results.full_response:
Not continue on their current student visa because they must maintain enrolment in a full-time registered course.

question_results.question: You recruited a student to study in a Foundation Year Program. The student has not been attending classes. The student is on a student visa and has been absent from class for two weeks now. The Institution should:
correct_answers: Contact you immediately and ask for help in locating the student.
extracted_answers: Report the student without seeking to find out where the student is.
question_results.full_response:
The education provider must have documented policies and procedures stating whether they will consider compassionate and compelling circumstances. The provider must also issue the student a written notification of their intention to report the student to DHA, informing the student they have 20 working days to access the provider’s complaints and appeals process. Once this timeframe has lapsed or the appeals process has been finalized and found in favor of the provider, the provider reports the breach of the student visa condition using PRISMS. The student will then receive a notice informing them that they must attend at an Immigration office within 28 days, or their visa may be cancelled.

question_results.question: The parents of a student you recruited to study in Australia call you. Their son is very ill and has been taken to hospital. He cannot attend classes and the parents are not sure what to do. You seek advice from your liaison at the student’s school regarding his attendance and then tell his parents:
correct_answers: To make sure their son gets a medical certificate from the doctor or hospital so that he can show this to the institution (and DHA if necessary) to prove he has been sick.
extracted_answers: To make sure their son gets a medical certificate from the doctor or hospital so that he can show this to the institution (and DHA if necessary) to prove he has been sick.
question_results.full_response:
Medical authorities may not agree to communicate with you or the education provider. However, medical authorities will always communicate with the student’s parents, unless the student has expressed otherwise. It is better to work closely with the education provider because they are in a better position to obtain information, especially if you live outside of Australia.

question_results.question:
One of the other counsellors in your office comes to ask your advice on the following situation:
A student will study in an ELICOS program for 6 months and then enter into a Masters of Biotechnology course. The student has paid her tuition fees and the Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) for the ELICOS course. She wants to pay her tuition fees for the Masters course but the university is asking her to also pay OSHC. The counsellor is unsure about what the student should do about their OSHC for the Masters course.
You advise the counsellor that the student:
correct_answers: needs to take out OSHC for the Masters course too before applying for a student visa as it is compulsory for international students to have health insurance for all courses in a package of offers while studying in Australia.
extracted_answers: needs to take out OSHC for the Masters course too before applying for a student visa as it is compulsory for international students to have health insurance for all courses in a package of offers while studying in Australia.
question_results.full_response:
The student needs to have OSHC for the entire period from their arrival date in Australia to the student visa's expiration date. The university is correct to ask her to pay OSHC for the Masters course.

question_results.question: A student visa in Australia:
correct_answers: Is issued by DHA under the Migration Act 1958.
extracted_answers: Is issued by DHA under the Migration Act 1958.
question_results.full_response:
Here are some key points regarding student visas in Australia:

*   Individuals can study in Australia on a tourist visa for a maximum of three months or on a working holiday visa for a maximum of four months. For longer periods of study, a student visa is required.
*   Students studying Australian programs outside of Australia do not need a student visa.
*   When applying for a student visa, a student may need to undergo health examinations.
*   Adequate health insurance is a mandatory requirement.
*   There are English language proficiency requirements, but some students are exempt.
*   Student visa holders need to meet certain criteria set out in migration legislation.
*   If working as an agent in Australia, you must be a Registered Migration Agent (RMA) to provide immigration advice.


Sources:

question_results.question: The basic guidelines that describe the work rights students have while on a student visa are:
correct_answers: A student can work up to 40 hours per fortnight when their program is in session and for unlimited hours during vacation times.
extracted_answers: A student can work up to 40 hours per fortnight when their program is in session and for unlimited hours during vacation times.
question_results.full_response:
Student visa holders are granted permission to work, eliminating the need to apply separately upon arrival in Australia. As of July 1, 2023, students can work up to 48 hours per fortnight during course sessions and unlimited hours during recognized school breaks. A student’s family member can work up to 48 hours per fortnight once the student has commenced their course. If the student is enrolled in a master's or doctorate degree, the family member may work unlimited hours.

extracted_answers: The student is responsible for informing her education provider of her change of address.

question_results.question: Which of the following statements is TRUE about student complaints?
correct_answers: A student must access the institution’s internal complaint process before they contact the OSO or State Ombudsman.
extracted_answers: Students only the have the right to complain in certain, specified circumstances.
question_results.full_response:
Students have a right to complain if they do not receive the services they pay for. An agent may be asked to help a student understand the complaint process, or the agent may be the subject of the complaint. Common complaints include refund and fee disputes, external appeals for transfer/release letters, and unsatisfactory attendance or course progress. The OSO does not investigate complaints made more than 12 months after the incident.

question_results.question: Which of the following students being assessed under regular evidentiary requirements would NOT need to present an English proficiency test score to obtain a student visa?
correct_answers: A student who has completed two years of study in Australia prior to applying for a visa.
extracted_answers: A student who has completed two years of study in Australia prior to applying for a visa.
question_results.full_response:
A student would not need to present an English test score if they are an ELICOS, Schools, Secondary Exchange, or Postgraduate Research Student; have completed a Senior Secondary Certificate of Education in English in Australia within the last two years; are a Foreign Affairs and Defence sponsored student; are a citizen of the United Kingdom, United States of America, New Zealand, Canada, or Ireland; or have studied for more than five years in English in Australia, United Kingdom, United States of America, New Zealand, Canada, Ireland, or South Africa.

question_results.question: Unsatisfactory academic performance means:
correct_answers: That a student has failed the majority of their subjects and would be unable to continue studying in their current course.
extracted_answers: That a student has failed the majority of their subjects and would be unable to continue studying in their current course.
question_results.full_response:
A student must achieve satisfactory academic results, and if they don't, they need to follow the relevant appeal process. If the appeal is unsuccessful, the education provider must have documented policies and procedures for monitoring course progress and determining when a student has failed to make satisfactory course progress. The provider must also issue the student a written notification of their intention to report the student to DHA and inform the student they have 20 working days to access the provider’s complaints and appeals process. Once this timeframe has lapsed or the appeals process has been finalised in favor of the provider, the provider reports the visa breach using PRISMS.

question_results.question: Which of the following statements about student visas is True?
correct_answers: When the visa application states that an individual must be of good character, this means that they must have no criminal record or poor previous visa compliance record.
extracted_answers: When the visa application states that an individual must be of good character, this means that they must have no criminal record or poor previous visa compliance record.
question_results.full_response:
Student visa holders are granted permission to work and do not need to apply separately for it.

question_results.question: As an education agent you recruited a 17-year- old student to study in an English program. The parents of the student have asked you to provide them with the student’s results. You ask the English College to give you these results. They:
correct_answers: Give you the student’s results as the student is under 18 and this is allowed by law.
extracted_answers: Cannot give you the student’s results unless the student gives permission.
question_results.full_response:
Cannot provide the results unless the student gives his/her consent in writing.
